comments:
Build 200308271620, IBM 1.4.1

An IllegalMonitorStateException occurs when trying to do the following:

1.  With fresh workspace, create a connection to dev.eclipse.org:/home/eclipse
2.  check out org.eclipse.swt and org.eclipse.swt.win32 from the HEAD stream
3.  run the build.xml in org.eclipse.swt.win32 - default target.

See attached .log for stack trace.

Created an attachment (id=5900)
.log
The problem does not occur with Sun 1.4.2.

I don't immediately see in the code where a monitor is needed or being obtained.
The usual culprits (wait or notify) do not exist in 
ConsoleDocumentPartitioner.checkOverflow

I was unable to build the project. When I import and build (I get an error 
dialog), and I find this in the log:

(NOTE: I had auto-build on).

I also get an "unable to create .classpath" file error, so running the build 
does not work.

The exception only occurs after running Ant on the build.xml file in 
org.eclipse.swt.win32.
(Oops my problem was compiling against 1.3.1 and running on 1.4.1).

I was unable to reproduce (in dev mode - i.e. runtime workbench), using IBM 
build cn141-20030522.

Sonia, are there instructions on eclipse.org for doing an Eclipse SDK build? 
(I'd like to build against 1.4.1 so I can try this first hand, rather than in 
dev mode).

Here is a link to the instructions:

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%
7E/org.eclipse.releng.eclipsebuilder/readme.html?rev=HEAD&content-
type=text/html

I am able to reproduce the problem, but this looks like a VM bug. The code in 
question has a synchrnoized block, but we do not explicitly send any "wait" 
or "notify" messages - i.e. the syncronization is controlled by the VM.

Sonia, is there a newer IBM VM we can test this on? Otherwise, how do we report 
the bug to the IBM VM team?

There is a 1.4.1 sr1 available.  I will obtain and let you know when it is 
available.
Sonia, is this still a problem?
Was unable to reproduce in 200402101600 with IBM vm 1.4.1 sr1.

Created an attachment (id=7870)
.log from I20040210
Sorry, I lied (was not looking in the right place).  See attachment above.
Thanks, Sonia. Marking as "works for me".
